title: Four Pillars Chart
dayMasterExplanation: The Day Master represents "yourself" in the Four Pillars. Get a more detailed interpretation through AI consultation.
dayMasterGap: Gap Wood (甲) - Upright and strong like a tall tree
dayMasterEul: Eul Wood (乙) - Flexible and adaptable like vines
dayMasterByeong: Byeong Fire (丙) - Bright and passionate like the sun
dayMasterJeong: Jeong Fire (丁) - Gentle and delicate like candlelight
dayMasterMu: Mu Earth (戊) - Reliable and stable like a mountain
dayMasterGi: Gi Earth (己) - Embracing and practical like farmland
dayMasterGyeong: Gyeong Metal (庚) - Strong and decisive like iron
dayMasterSin: Sin Metal (辛) - Sharp and delicate like a jewel
dayMasterIm: Im Water (壬) - Broad and wise like the ocean
dayMasterGye: Gye Water (癸) - Clear and intuitive like a stream
checkManseryeokAndOheng: Check your Manseryeok and Five Elements distribution.
selectProfileToCheck: Select a profile to view Manseryeok
bigeop_desc: People who share the same element as you. Easy to understand and empathize with, making great friends or colleagues. However, pursuing the same goals can create competition. Strong Companions energy means strong independence and pride.
siksang_desc: The energy you create and express outward. Manifests as eloquence, writing talent, and artistic ability. Strong Output energy means excellent self-expression. Also connected to creativity - "giving birth" to ideas and works.
jaeseong_desc: The energy you control and manage. Connected to earning and managing money, practical sense. Strong Wealth energy means desire for material gain and pragmatism. For men, it can also represent a wife or girlfriend.
gwanseong_desc: The energy that controls and disciplines you. Connected to career, profession, and social norms. Moderate Authority means responsibility and social recognition. Too strong can mean stress or pressure. For women, it can represent a husband or boyfriend.
inseong_desc: The energy that nurtures and protects you. Connected to help from mother, mentors, and benefactors. Strong Resource energy means love of learning and thoughtfulness. Also related to documents and certifications, favorable for study and exams.
ohengExplanationSubtitle: Learn the basic principles of Saju easily
ohengExplanationBody:
The Five Elements (五行) is an Eastern philosophy that explains the changes of all things in the universe through five energies.

Wood (木), Fire (火), Earth (土), Metal (金), Water (水) - these five elements help each other (generation) and restrain each other (overcoming) to maintain nature's balance.
balanceExplanation:
Generation and overcoming are not about good or bad. The ideal state is when the Five Elements support and restrain each other in balance.

Understanding which elements are strong or weak in your chart helps identify areas for improvement.
tabOhengDesc: Analyze Five Elements and Ten Stars distribution
tabHapchungDesc: Analyze harmony and clash between stems and branches
tabUnsungDesc: View the 12 Life Stages energy flow
tabSinsalDesc: Check 12 Spirit Stars and special spirits
tabGongmangDesc: Analyze void branches and palace positions
sipsungExplanationBody:
The Ten Stars represent 10 types of relationships between your Day Master and other stems.
Stars that help you, stars that show your talents, wealth stars, etc.
Learn what role each star plays in your chart.
unsungExplanationBody:
The 12 Life Stages divide human life into 12 phases.
Birth (Growth), development (Bathing~Crown), peak (Prosperity~Emperor),
decline (Decline~Tomb), and preparation for new beginnings (Cut~Nurture).
gungseongExplanationBody:
Palace positions represent the life areas each pillar governs.
Year=Ancestors/Society, Month=Parents/Career, Day=Self/Spouse, Hour=Children/Later years.
sinsalExplanationBody:
Spirit Stars are special energies present in a chart.
Auspicious spirits bring luck, inauspicious spirits signal caution.
However, modern astrology uses them only as reference.
gongmangExplanationBody:
Void means 'an empty position'.
Two earthly branches that are missing from the 60 Jiazi cycle become void.
Palace positions in void may have weakened energy in those areas.
ohengHelpBody:
Five Elements shows the distribution of 5 basic energies (Wood/Fire/Earth/Metal/Water) in your chart.

Ten Stars represent 10 types of relationships between your Day Master and other stems.

Viewing both analyses together reveals your chart's strengths and areas for improvement.
singang_helpBody:
Strength indicates whether your Day Master's energy is strong or weak.

If strong, you tend to be assertive. If weak, you tend to need external support.

The Favorable Element is the key element that balances your chart.
singang_percentile: {percent}% of people fall in this range.
fortune_slideHint: Slide left or right to see more.
fortune_daeunHelpBody:
Decade Fortune is the large fortune cycle that changes every 10 years.

Based on the birth month's stem-branch, it moves forward or backward,
showing life's major trends and turning points.
fortune_yeununHelpBody:
Annual Fortune is the yearly fortune cycle.

It shows how the year's stem-branch interacts with your chart.
Discover this year's opportunities and points of caution.
fortune_wolunHelpBody:
Monthly Fortune is the monthly fortune cycle.

It shows how the month's stem-branch interacts with your chart.
Discover this month's opportunities and points of caution.
noHapchungDescription:
No special harmony or clash relationships were found between the stems and branches in your chart.
This indicates a stable structure.
hapchungExplanationBody:
Harmony is an attracting relationship,
Clash is a colliding relationship,
Punishment is a harmful relationship without courtesy,
Destruction is a breaking relationship,
Harm is an envious relationship,
Grudge is a distant resentment relationship.
tabManseryeokLongDesc: A basic chart showing the four pillars (Year, Month, Day, Hour) and Five Elements distribution of your Four Pillars of Destiny at a glance.
tabOhengLongDesc: Analyzes the distribution and balance of the five energies: Wood, Fire, Earth, Metal, Water. Excess or deficiency of elements affects personality and fortune.
tabSingangLongDesc: Determines whether the Day Master's energy is strong or weak. Strong means independent; weak means needing support from others. Also analyzes the Favorable Element (needed element).
tabDaeunLongDesc: Shows the flow of fortune changing in 10-year cycles. Through Decade, Annual, and Monthly fortunes, you can understand life's major trends and timing.
tabHapchungLongDesc: Analyzes Harmony, Clash, Punishment, Destruction, and Harm relationships between Heavenly Stems and Earthly Branches. Reveals harmony and conflict of energies in the chart.
tabSipsungLongDesc: Shows 10 types of relationships (Companions, Output, Wealth, Authority, Resource) between the Day Master and other stems/branches. Core analysis for personality, wealth, and career fortune.
tabUnsungLongDesc: The 12 Life Stages show what state the Day Master's energy is in at each Earthly Branch. Views life's energy flow in 12 stages including Growth, Prosperity, Emperor, etc.
tabSinsalLongDesc: Analyzes special energies (Spirit Stars) appearing in the chart. Identifies auspicious and inauspicious influences such as Travel Star, Peach Blossom Star, etc.
tabGongmangLongDesc: Finds empty (Void) Earthly Branches based on the Day Pillar. The energy in those areas may weaken, but if something inauspicious is void, its negative effect is reduced.
singang_singangHelpDesc: A numerical indicator of whether the Day Master's energy is strong or weak. 50% or above is considered Strong, below is Weak.
singang_yongsinHelpDesc: The most needed element that supplements the deficient energy in the chart. Knowing your favorable element helps determine advantageous directions, colors, and careers.
singang_analysisHelpDesc: Analyzes the ratio of supporting energies (Resource/Companions) vs. restraining energies (Output/Wealth/Authority) to determine strength.
fortune_daeunHelpDesc: The major fortune flow that changes in 10-year cycles. When the Decade Fortune changes, life's major direction shifts, and fortune varies based on its relationship with the Day Master.
fortune_yeununHelpDesc: Fortune that changes every year. Also called Annual Fortune, the year's flow is determined by how the year's stems and branches relate to the chart.
fortune_wolunHelpDesc: Fortune that changes every month. The detailed fortune flow based on monthly branch changes helps with short-term planning.
ohengHelpDesc_ohengAndSipsung: Comprehensively analyzes the distribution of Five Elements (Wood/Fire/Earth/Metal/Water) and Ten Stars (Companions/Output/Wealth/Authority/Resource) relationships.
ohengHelpDesc_oheng: Shows the distribution of five energies: Wood, Fire, Earth, Metal, Water. The balance of elements affects personality and fortune.
ohengHelpDesc_sipsung: Classifies relationships between the Day Master and other stems/branches into 10 types (Companions, Output, Wealth, Authority, Resource).
ohengHelpDesc_myOheng: The Five Elements attribute of the Day Master (you). Your element determines personality, aptitude, compatibility, and more.
gungseongUnsungSubtitle: Each palace's life stage and meaning
normalEnergyDesc: Not in Void - normal energy is expressed.
sipsungDetailBody: Based on the Day Master, it represents the relationship with other stems and branches. 10 types of relationships are determined by the Five Elements generation/overcoming and Yin-Yang harmony.
sipsungBigeopDesc: Companions: Same element - siblings, competitors, ego
sipsungSiksangDesc: Output: Element I generate - expression, talent, children
sipsungJaeseongDesc: Wealth: Element I overcome - money, father(M), wife(M)
sipsungGwanseongDesc: Authority: Element that overcomes me - career, honor, husband(F)
sipsungInseongDesc: Resource: Element that generates me - study, documents, mother
unsungDetailBody: The 12 Life Stages show what state the Day Master's energy is in at each Earthly Branch. Like a person's lifetime, it expresses the cycle from birth to death in 12 stages.
gungseongDetailBody: Palace positions represent the life areas that each of the 4 pillars (Year, Month, Day, Hour) governs. Through each palace's life stage, you can understand the energy state in that area.
sinsalDetailBody: Spirit Stars are special energies in the Four Pillars, analyzing auspicious and inauspicious influences. The 12 Spirit Stars identify characteristics of each branch based on the year branch.
gongmangDetailBody: Void means 'empty' - certain Earthly Branches are empty based on the Day Pillar. Palace positions in Void may have weakened or hollow energy in those areas.
gongmangTipBody: Void is not necessarily bad. If something inauspicious is in Void, its negative effect is actually reduced.
gungseongGongmangSubtitle: Void status and interpretation by palace
